New Records: Fernando Tatis Jr. became the first visiting player to hit multiple Statcast-tracked home runs of at least 445 feet at Dodger Stadium
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a moonshot in the top of the fifth inning off Jack Flaherty
Jake Cronenworth worked a two-out walk against Dodgers closer Michael Kopech
Brandon Lockridge pinch-ran and swiped second in the ninth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Padres manager Mike Shildt emphasized the importance of winning each game, saying 'We’re looking to win each one.'
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt expressed pride in the team's resilience, saying 'I love where our team’s come from. I love where our team’s at. And I love where our team’s going.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres have secured their place in the postseason, but the loss takes NL West fate out of their hands
The Padres will be headed for a three-game Wild Card Series beginning next Tuesday if they lose
The Padres have locked up the head-to-head tiebreaker over L.A., but would need to gain two additional games this weekend
